text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
IRM 1.4.5 provides IRS managers with the background relating to delivery of corporate tax administration tools, where and how to access them, and related training materials.
The following changes were made to IRM 1.4.5:

IRM Subsection IRM Content Changes IRM 1.4.5.4.1 Updated title to change abbreviation from ER to Electronic Research. IRM 1.4.5.4.2 Changed Saba Meeting to Online Training and clariﬁed that it may be IRS or vendor led. Throughout the Editorial changes made throughout the IRM IRM section, including hyperlink updates.
This IRM is intended for IRS managers Servicewide.
Table of Contents
Permissible Uses of Extracts from Commercial Research Services
) Purpose: This IRM section provides an overview of the program to commercial research products and services to support tax administration and ties. (
) Audience: All IRS managers involved in research and analysis of data to support tax administration activities. (
) Policy Owner: The Office of Servicewide Policy, Directives and Electronic Resources (SPDER), under Research, Applied Analytics and Statistics (

) Program Owner: SPDER is the program office responsible for overseeing purchase of enterprise-wide research products and services, and for guidance on the use of these tools. Each IRS organization is responsible for establishing personnel to administer login access for the tools. (
) Primary Stakeholders: All IRS organizations (
) Prior to the existence of SPDER, individual IRS organizations were each taining their own separate electronic research contracts (often with the same vendor). (
) In

, the Commissioner recognized a need to centralize electronic contracts to create the capability for all IRS business units to conduct elec- tronic tax law research, foster better collaboration of research efforts across the service and to signiﬁcantly reduce research costs. On December

, the Office of Servicewide Policy, Directives and Electronic Research officially stood up as an organization. The name was subsequently changed Servicewide Policy, Directives and Electronic Resources. SPDER designs, delivers, and manages a set of tax administration and knowledge tools to enable IRS employees to meet their responsibilities for enforcement, compliance and customer service. (
) IRS Restructuring and Reform Act of
(RRA
) Policy Statement
governs IRS research activities. The guidance in this section conforms with Policy Statement
establishing the foundation for research in the IRS to improve operations and decision-making through the service.

2 1.4 Resource Guide for Managers a. The EROC members list is posted on ReferenceNet at http://rnet.web.irs. gov/EROC/members.aspx. b. The EROC serves as a decision-making body and makes recommenda- tions on electronic research issues, including product content and fea- tures, training, and problem resolution. (2) SPDER requires quarterly reports from each service provider documenting access, usage, training, and known issues. (3) SPDER reviews all requests for local (e.g. non-enterprise) electronic research services to ensure they are not duplicating existing contracts. (1) The table lists commonly used acronyms and their deﬁnitions: Acronyms BOD Business Operating Division EROC Electronic Research Oversight Council RAAS Research, Applied Analytics and Statistics SPDER Servicewide Policy, Directives and Electronic Resources (1) The following are related resources: • Memorandum announcing the creation of the Office of Servicewide Resources Policy, Directives and Electronic Research (SPDER), presently known as the Office of Servicewide Policy, Directives and Electronic Resources (SPDER), refer to http://spder.web.irs.gov/officeinfo/general/ SPDERMemo.pdf. • ReferenceNet webpage at http://rnet.web.irs.gov/. (1) The following table lists the types of research products and services available. Category Product Tax, Legal, • Internal Revenue Code Business, and • Income tax regulations News • IRS administrative decisions • IRS forms • Internal Revenue Manual • Federal tax judicial decisions • Commercial tax services and tax related books • Treatises and periodicals and other non-tax legal, news, and business sources

SPDER is responsible for contract administration for all enterprise-wide elec- tronic research contracts except the credit bureau contracts owned by
(07-08-2011) Electronic Research
Employees have immediate access to current procedures, forms, documents, agency decisions, regulations, related court cases as well primary sources and secondary sources for tax

related research Time and money spent traveling to libraries and courthouses to perform research is reduced Electronic research is faster than perusing paper sources The ability to validate references ensures research results are accurate
1.4 Resource Guide for Managers
a. Classroom Training
Provides training for either a general or speciﬁc audience b. Online Training
Offers training at your computer with a live IRS or vendor instructor via web conference c. Computer Based Training
Gives you the ﬂexibility to review the you need when it’s convenient for you d. Quick Reference Guides
Help you get started with common tasks e. Telephonic Training
Allows for one
on
one or small group training by phone tailored to your research needs f. User Guides
Provide detailed instructions on how to use various tools
Note: These products are linked to cited references, allowing access to all research material from one place.

Employees may not use asset/locator tools to search or browse for them- selves, friends, relatives, celebrities, government officials, etc. Searching or browsing for these people is a violation of IRS policy as well as a
data can email SPDER for additional information at spder@irs.gov. (

) Local contracts may still be required for data that is unavailable from the national contract vehicles. For example, in some states the Department of Motor Vehicles does not sell records to third-party vendors. Local contracts are predominately funded by SB/SE, however, these funds are expected to cover
There are IRS restrictions on the purchase of electronic research services, locator services, electronic assets/locator, and credit bureau information services. See IRM
, Contract Restrictions. This policy applies to the purchase of all local contracts and must be followed when seeking to purchase services outside the national contracts.
) IRS has a national contract for credit bureau data. SB/SE owns and this contract. (

) Under this contract full Credit Reports are only available to IRS employees working balance due cases. The Fair Credit Reporting Act requires this tion. Credit Reports can be a valuable source of information regarding an individual’s addresses, assets, ﬁnancial relationships, and judgment/lien mation where available. (
) Additional details about the Credit Bureau Program and Fair Credit Act may be found in IRM
, Locating Taxpayers and Their Assets and IRM
, Legal Reference Guide for Revenue Officers, Summonses. Note: IRS employees in Examination functions have to issue a summons to a credit bureau in order to obtain a taxpayer’s credit report. (

) A nationwide Interagency Agreement provides IRS employees with Public Access to Court Electronic Records (PACER). Through PACER, users can through access case and docket information from Federal Appellate, District and ruptcy courts, and from the U.S. Party/Case Index. (
) PACER funding: a. Annually, designated Business Operating Division (BOD) contacts will provide SB/SE PACER POCs with their employees’ (users’) cost estimates by July

st, for the upcoming ﬁscal year. b. SB/SE will fund the agreement to cover all PACER users with an IRS work-related need based on the estimates provided by the BOD c. Designated BOD contacts will advise SB/SE POCs of signiﬁcant to the estimates as they become known. Signiﬁcant increases in costs may become the responsibility of the individual business unit. d. All BODs are responsible for monitoring usage to ensure IRS are using it for IRS work-related purposes and for ensuring costs are within the estimates provided. e. SB/SE POCs will contact users to verify receipt and acceptance of PACER services. (

(04-11-2019) Court Records through PACER
Annually, designated Business Operating Division (BOD) contacts will provide SB/SE PACER POCs with their employees’ (users’) anticipated cost estimates by July

st, for the upcoming ﬁscal year. SB/SE will fund the agreement to cover all PACER users with an IRS work-related need based on the estimates provided by the BOD Designated BOD contacts will advise SB/SE POCs of signiﬁcant changes to the estimates as they become known. Signiﬁcant increases in costs may become the responsibility of the individual business unit. All BODs are responsible for monitoring usage to ensure IRS employees are using it for IRS work-related purposes and for ensuring costs are within the estimates provided. SB/SE POCs will contact users to verify receipt and acceptance of PACER services.
) If you do not have a PACER ID, you may request one using Online
) More information on the agreement, funding, point of contact, as well as access to PACER is provided from the Referenc
et web site at http://rnet. web.irs.gov/Resources/PACER.aspx (

) SPDER manages the Servicewide Electronic Research contracts which are up at agency level with a single funding point for all delivery orders and requi- sitions. Exception: SB/SE coordinates and manages the Asset/Locator contracts for local or regionalized services and the National Credit bureau contract. (

) Contracts are for multiple years, allowing IRS to purchase them at a consoli- dated bulk rate with a volume discount. This allows IRS to provide unlimited access to all employees who need to research, at a reduced cost per person. (

) A key component of IRS’ standardization of electronic research services is intent to acquire, at the best value to the government, as much content for an ideal tax and legal reference library as possible through one source. content will be obtained, as necessary, through existing avenues such as Fedlink or GSA schedules. (
) Offices must obtain approval from SPDER before procuring commercial elec- tronic research services, or training for these services (

) Copyright laws and restrictions apply to electronic research vendor data and use. Fair Use of copyrighted material as deﬁned by the courts allows: of a. Making multiple copies for use in a classroom b. Copying and inserting materials in a training document c. Copying, downloading, and distributing materials for internal use by IRS employees d. Copying a document for a single person (i.e. a taxpayer or for a case (

) Obtain explicit permission from SPDER at spder@irs.gov when: a. Using vendor content in training materials b. Posting vendor content on the IRS public web site c. Releasing vendor content as part of a FOIA request d. Using vendor content in any way not described above Reminder: When referencing content, link directly to the source. Do not download and post a stand-alone copy of legal source documents to internal sites. By linking to the source document you will ensure it is current.
(3) If you do not have a PACER ID, you may request one using Online 5081.
